dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so big news this week, uh, JPMorgan Chase, which has been like, top dog for ages, unexpectedly lost its top spot!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so big news this week, uh, J P Morgan Chase, which has been like, top dog for ages, unexpectedly lost its top spot!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The banking giant, which boasted $2.7 trillion in assets as of the 12 months ending on April 18, 2019, overtook Apple and Berkshire Hathaway to claim the top spot on the list.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, wow, really? That's a huge shake-up. Who managed to, you know, knock them off their perch?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, wow, really? That's a huge shake-up. Who managed to, you know, knock them off their perch?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's Apple and Berkshire Hathaway. I mean, Apple, Bank of America, Wells Fargo, Exxon Mobil, they're still in the top five, but JPMorgan? Gone from number one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's Apple and Berkshire Hathaway. I mean, Apple, Bank of America, Wells Fargo, Exxon Mobil, they're still in the top five, but J P Morgan? Gone from number one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The banking giant, which boasted $2.7 trillion in assets as of the 12 months ending on April 18, 2019, overtook Apple and Berkshire Hathaway to claim the top spot on the list.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's wild. But like, the overall picture for US companies is still massive, right? We're talking over twelve trillion dollars combined for the top fifty.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's wild. But like, the overall picture for U S companies is still massive, right? We're talking over twelve trillion dollars combined for the top fifty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The top 50 U.S. companies have a combined market capitalization of more than $12 trillion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And here's the interesting bit, you know? Globally, it's all banks, but for the US top fifty, only six are major banks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And here's the interesting bit, you know? Globally, it's all banks, but for the U S top fifty, only six are major banks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Though the global list, which ranks public companies using a composite score of revenue, profits, assets and market value, is dominated by banks and financial services companies, just six of the top 50 companies in the United States are major banks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which is kinda surprising. I mean, weren't their profits down anyway, uh, due to those tax cuts President Trump put in place back in 2017?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is kinda surprising. I mean, weren't their profits down anyway, uh, due to those tax cuts President Trump put in place back in twenty seventeen?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Citigroup, US Bancorp, and PNC join JPMorgan, Bank of America, and Wells Fargo round out the group of major banks, of which all but PNC saw rising profits due in large part to tax cuts set in motion by President Trump in 2017.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. That's a big part of it. And speaking of interesting, Apple's still third on the US list, but get this, it's not even the most profitable public company in the world anymore.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. That's a big part of it. And speaking of interesting, Apple's still third on the U S list, but get this, it's not even the most profitable public company in the world anymore.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple ranks third on the U.S. list in 2019, though it remains the most profitable public company in the world, pulling in nearly $60 billion last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, barely pulled in sixty billion. [interrupts] So, it's like, market cap isn't always about raw profit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, barely pulled in sixty billion. So, it's like, market cap isn't always about raw profit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple ranks third on the U.S. list in 2019, though it remains the most profitable public company in the world, pulling in nearly $60 billion last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And then you have Microsoft and Alphabet, like numbers eight and nine, Amazon and Walmart, they're all thriving, comfortably in the top ten.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And then you have Microsoft and Alphabet, like numbers eight and nine, Amazon and Walmart, they're all thriving, comfortably in the top ten.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Retail giants Amazon and Walmart aren't far behind at numbers 13 and 14.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the tech and retail giants are just, uh, dominating, aren't they?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the tech and retail giants are just, uh, dominating, aren't they?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. But the big comeback story, I think, is Berkshire Hathaway. They had a huge writedown, you know, with Kraft Heinz, but they're still 12th.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. But the big comeback story, I think, is Berkshire Hathaway. They had a huge writedown, you know, with Kraft Heinz, but they're still twelfth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Warren Buffet's storied holding company ranks 12th this year thanks to a major writedown (courtesy of its holding Kraft Heinz) in the fourth quarter of 2018.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And Citigroup! From 190 on an extended list to number seven? That's just, like, an insane jump.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Citigroup! From one hundred ninety on an extended list to number seven? That's just, like, an insane jump.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Citigroup, on the other hand, ranked 190 on an extended list in 2018 thanks to losses related to assets overseas, rocketed back up to number 7.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know! It really just reflects how tumultuous 2018 was, especially the end of the year. S&P 500 swinging a thousand points in a day!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! It really just reflects how tumultuous twenty eighteen was, especially the end of the year. S and P five hundred swinging a thousand points in a day!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: U.S. stocks had a tumultuous year in 2018, especially during the final month of the year when the S&P 500 swung 1,000 points in a single trading day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and with the trade war tensions, um, between the US and China, it feels like volatility is just the new normal now, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and with the trade war tensions, um, between the U S and China, it feels like volatility is just the new normal now, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Markets rebounded during the first quarter of 2019, but the escalation of trade war tensions between the United States and China in recent weeks have investors wondering if that volatility and trade uncertainty, sure to have an enormous impact on American companies, is the new normal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Investors are like, 'Yep, expect more of this.' It's gonna have an enormous impact on American companies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Investors are like, Yep, expect more of this. It's gonna have an enormous impact on American companies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the escalation of trade war tensions between the United States and China in recent weeks have investors wondering if that volatility and trade uncertainty, sure to have an enormous impact on American companies, is the new normal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. A lot to keep an eye on for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. A lot to keep an eye on for sure.
